bug.author: elephantmipt
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug Report</denchmark-h>
Hi, I used WandbLogger and faced this problem <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37884009/80644617-9a6d9880-8a72-11ea-9833-a9ff345449aa.png></denchmark-link>
Also I noticed that splitted_epoch_metrics has structure like: {"train": {"loss": 1, "loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 1}, "valid": {"loss": 1,"loss_qa":0.5, "loss_clf": 0.5, "metric": 1}} What is propose of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/f58ffac876f514f3b52537d62b5c81b562a93fa9/catalyst/contrib/dl/callbacks/wandb.py#L172>here</denchmark-link> ? Maybe in this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/catalyst-team/catalyst/blob/f58ffac876f514f3b52537d62b5c81b562a93fa9/catalyst/contrib/dl/callbacks/wandb.py#L181>line</denchmark-link> we should pass instead of to method. If I do so error disappears and all works well. <denchmark-h:h3>How To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: I am running my script with and getting this error on epoch end. With <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/PUSSYMIPT/db95014542442f2e03cd1fddf7610b88>this</denchmark-link> config. Model is a multitask roberta with two heads, so I have three losses (main_loss=loss1+loss2, loss1, loss2) and one metric. So in I have something like, in variable i get , this is enough to reproduce key error. Anyway I don't think that error somehow depends on my code and will also reproduces with any experiment which doesn't have a loader which name starts with . Am I missing something? <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
Catalyst version: 20.04.2 PyTorch version: 1.5.0 TensorFlow version: N/A TensorBoard version: 2.2.1 OS: Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS (Bionic Beaver) Python version: 3.7.7 CUDA runtime version: 10.1 <denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
I can open PR
